alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alachua; Western Alachua; Western Clay; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 6:41AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN ALACHUA... NORTHWESTERN PUTNAM AND SOUTHWESTERN CLAY COUNTIES THROUGH 715 AM EST... At 641 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near University Of Florida, or 8 miles south of Gainesville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 40 mph, pea size hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Interlachen, Melrose, Hawthorne, Lake Geneva, Florahome, Rochelle, Melrose Landing, Hollister, Newnans Lake, and Micanopy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Alachua; Western Alachua; Western Clay; Western Putnam
